member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNode
member.summary: Container of an abstract UIElement within the hierarchical tree structure of the rendering scene graph.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNode.Node
member.summary: Contains the UIElement at this node within the rendering scene graph.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNode.ParentNode
member.summary: References the current parent node within the hierarchical tree structure.

remarks.p: The ParentNode is null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) when this IUIHierarchyNode implementation represents the root of the hierarchical tree structure making up the scene graph.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNode.ChildNodes
member.summary: References the current child nodes, if any, within the hierarchical tree structure.

remarks.p: Consumers of this interface must check before accessing the ChildNodes directly because some implementations may lazily create a collection of child nodes on request. Failure to follow this guidance may cause some implementations to report HasChildNodes as being True when ChildNodes is an empty list.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNode.HasChildNodes
member.summary: Indicates whether the current node in the hierarchical tree structure represents a leaf node, having no child nodes, within the scene graph.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNodeList.Remove(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNode)
member.summary: Removes the first occurrence of an IUIHierarchyNode within the list.
member.param: The node being removed from the list.

remarks.p: The IUIHierarchyNodeList is comprised of contiguous elements causing the IUIHierarchyNode instances following the removed node to move up one space filling-in the vacancy. Applications retaining indexes to nodes later in the list must refresh (or invalidate) these indexes following one or more removal operations.

Implementations of that require the Remove method to function based on a node's value equivalency must override Equals and GetHashCode when their class implements IUIHierarchyNode, otherwise the node must be reference identical to an IUIHierarchyNode within the list for it to be removed.
When node cannot be located within the list, this method has no effect.

member.exception: Thrown when either of the or properties return True.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement
member.summary: Abstraction of a rectangular UI element within the scene graph.

remarks.p: UI elements are abstractions of the control surfaces comprising a web element.

Each such control surfaces may have a certain style of appearance, it may offer a certain degree of user interactivity through receiving focus and/or handling client-side events, and it may expose other appearance-impacting properties.
They may be related to a object that is meaningful in the context of more specialized UIElement subclasses.

Every UI element also has the specialized knowledge of how to render itself, frequently driven by the settings of its properties and the its been associated with. This target is meaningful within the context of more specialized UIElement subclasses. These subclasses may further override the method to customize the appearance or build off of a template established by its base classes.

UI elements are maintained in a hierarchical tree structure starting with the most expansive rectangular region at the root of this tree, and subsequent UI elements in progressively deeper child collections that cover decreasingly-sized regions. When rendered this tree (the scene graph) gets flattened such that deeper children within this tree take precedence over and cover regions of their parents.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty instance of UIElement that has no corresponding target object that it renders.

remarks.p: By default, all UIElement instances are initially created with their state set to True. If an application requires that the UIElement be disabled, it should set that after the hierarchical scene graph has been constructed. This allows the setting to cascade across all child UIElement instances that compose this one.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.#ctor(System.Object,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.IUIHierarchyNode@)
member.summary: Creates an instance of UIElement around an underlying object. The UIElement represents the look and feel of this object as it will be rendered.
member.param: An underlying object that may have additional properties on it that determine how it should be rendered. Support for specific types of target objects are added by more specialized subclasses of UIElement.
An IUIHierarchyNode that is returned to the caller which wraps the newly constructed UIElement. Inheritors should attach this to the tree-structured scene graph they become a part of.

remarks.p: By default, all UIElement instances are initially created with their state set to True. If an application requires that the UIElement be disabled, it should set that after the hierarchical scene graph has been constructed. This allows the setting to cascade across all child UIElement instances that compose this one.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.InitializeView(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: This method supports the internal Infragistics infrastructure, and is not intended for application use.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.RenderStyle(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style)
member.summary: Renders a repository-managed style to HTML as either an in-line style or a CSS class attribute.
member.param: Where to write the HTML.
A style instance managed by the StyleRepository.

remarks.p: Style instances that you can access through your StyleContext or off of your view element are managed by the StyleRepository.
Before RenderStyle can be called, the SmartRenderer must be initialized on the UI elements' scene graph. RenderStyle will render nothing if this prerequisite hasn't been met.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.RenderStyle(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Renders a repository-managed structural style to HTML as either an in-line style or CSS class attribute.
member.param: Where to write the HTML.

A string identifying the structural style, this must be the same key that was used when the structural style was registered within the SmartRenderer, typically as part of it's InitializeStyles method.

remarks.p: Structural styles are those that are required to enforce the desired layout of the view element (for example, to have a regular proportionately-spaced grid layout). These styles are not alterable through the designer and typically must not be overridden, otherwise changes may interfere with the functionality of the view element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.AppendStyle(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style)
member.summary: Merges a pair of repository-managed Style instances.
member.param: The primary Style instance, frequently this is the Style being merged into.
The secondary Style instance, typically the one being merged from.
member.returns: A copy of style1 with the characteristics of style2 applied. Neither style1 nor style2 are directly affected by this operation.

remarks.p: For run-time applications, this merger is a merging of the CSS class names that will be rendered as part of the CSS class attribute. Therefore, at run-time the precedence of styles is resolved in accordance with the Cascading Style Sheet recommendation (in particular, a CSS class defined later in the document supercedes one defined earlier when both CSS classes are named in the same class attribute). The order of how styles get appended is inconsequential at run-time.
Before AppendStyle can be called, the SmartRenderer must be initialized on the UI elements' scene graph. AppendStyle returns the primary style, style1, unchanged when this prerequisite isn't met.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.AppendStyle(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style,System.String)
member.summary: Merges a repository-managed Style instance with a structural Style.
member.param: The primary Style instance.

A string identifying the structural style, this must be the same key that was used when the structural style was registered within the SmartRenderer, typically as part of it's InitializeStyles method.

remarks.p: Inheritors of UIElement use this method to append a structural style to an existing, repository-managed style. Appending the styles means appending the CSS class name of the structural style to the CSS class attribute that will be rendered at run-time. Structural style rules are meant to take precedence over other styles, because they ensure the layout and functional behavior needed by the view element. For this reason, the StyleRepository is responsible for ensuring their CSS class definitions appear at the top of the embedded CSS style sheet rendered into the HTML at run-time.
Before AppendStyle can be called, the SmartRenderer must be initialized on the UI elements' scene graph. AppendStyle returns the primary style, style1, unchanged when this prerequisite isn't met.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders the current UIElement to the specified HtmlTextWriter instance.
member.param: An HtmlTextWriter instance into which markup will be deposited as this UIElement instance, and the child UIElement instances composing it render themselves.

remarks.p: By default, this Render method doesn't emit any markup. It only iterates through its collection of child UIElement instances within the scene graph and asks them to render their markup, if any.

Inheritors wishing for their Render method to produce markup must override this method and furnish their own implementation to produce the markup that their UIElement instance adds to the composition. For child UIElement instances to properly receive the command to render themselves, the overridden method MUST call the base class' Render method, or dispatch calls to the Render methods of its children on its own.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.ShouldRenderChild(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement)
member.summary: Determines whether a particular child UIElement should have Render called upon it by the base class' implementation of Render.
member.param: The child UIElement.
member.returns: This method always returns True when child is not null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET); inheritors may override this implementation when providing custom logic to filter out certain child UIElements from being rendered by returning False when such conditions are met.

remarks.p: Inheritors should call the base implementation, and logically-AND the result of that call with the boolean result of their own custom processing. This ensures that a NullReferenceException doesn't occur because the base class' check of whether this child UIElement was null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) was overridden.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.PostRenderChild(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement)
member.summary: Notifies a parent UIElement following the rendering of one of its children.
member.param: The sink into which to deposit additional markup as may be required.
The child UIElement that has just rendered.

remarks.p: The base class implementation of this method does nothing. Inheritors may override this method to track information about the progress of the rendering, or follow the rendering of certain children with special rendering by the parent.

An example of when overriding PostRenderChild is necessary is if a parent containing this UIElement must render markup after every other child UIElement. In this example, the implementation provided by the subclass would need to maintain a counter, incrementing it as it receives each notification. On every second notice, the implementation could trigger special rendering code in the base class to produce this markup.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.Depth
member.summary: Calculates the depth of the current UIElement within the scene graph.

value.p: The depth, or distance from the root UIElement containing everything within the scene, of this UIElement instance when it is part of the scene graph.
When the current instance is detached from a scene graph, this property returns -1.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.Enabled
member.summary: Indicates whether this UIElement is enabled or disabled.
member.value: True when the current UIElement is enabled, otherwise False when it has been disabled.

remarks.p: Setting the Enabled property on a UIElement that is composed of many child UIElements also cascades down and enables/disables the children for a consistent look-and-feel.

An enabled UIElement generally has a default or non-disabled style applied to it, and if it supports user interactivity then it will do so. Conversely, a disabled UIElement will have a disabled style applied and does not expose user interactivity.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.Implementation
member.summary: Retrieves a reference to the type factories that conceal an interface's actual implementing class.
member.value: A reference to the UIElement.UIElementImplementation which contains methods for getting an implementation to one of the interfaces needed by a UIElement or its subclasses.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement.Key
member.summary: Identifies the current UIElement instance with a user-supplied name.
member.value: The name by which this user interface element is known during render-time, if one has been assigned. Otherwise the property may refer to null (or Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) when no key was assigned.

remarks.p: Some inheritors may employ the Key property as a tag that facilitates identifying or categorizing an instance of UIElement without requiring run-time type identifications (RTTI) in overrides of protected methods like and .

No checks are performed as to whether the key assigned is unique within the hierarchical scene graph, or any fragment thereof. It is the application's responsibility to handle the ramifications of having duplicate keys.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.StyleContext.AddStyle(System.Type,System.String,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style)
member.summary: Adds a Style to the StyleContext having a recognizable string identifier that specific types of UIElements can use to access this Style by reference.
member.param: A Type of UIElement instance being granted access to the style.
A string identifier that must be unique within all other styles granted to a uieType-typed UIElement and can be used to retrieve the style at a later time.
An object reference to the Style, most likely a property of the View element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.StyleContext.Close
member.summary: Prevents further additions from being made to the StyleContext.

remarks.p: The SmartRenderer uses a call to Close to prevent further additions to this StyleContext instance, effectively making it read-only. This should be done after all styles have been added from the View, and before the UIElements begin making requests for its style properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.StyleContext.GetStyle(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a Style granted to a particular type of UIElement using a string identifier it had been added with earlier.
member.param: A Type of UIElement instance being granted access to this Style.
A string identifying the requested Style.
member.returns: The requested style based on a lookup of the uieType and the styleId, if one had been added earlier.

member.summary: The FrameInterval object is used to denote the starting date and the ending date for which activities will be retrieved from the data source. member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleViewBase.LoadViewState(System.Object)
member.summary: Rehydrates the from a saved state object.
member.param: A saved state object that the ASP.NET Framework deserializes either from posted back data, or following a call to the Page's LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium. This saved state information should match the object given to the ASP.NET Framework when it called SaveViewState on a previous HTTP request.

remarks.p: Inheritors are strongly advised against overriding the base class' implementation of LoadViewState, as doing so will likely disrupt normal functionality of the 's support for viewstate management. Instead, there is considerable flexibility built into the SmartWebControl for supporting viewstate management of subobjects and properties, and inheritors should leverage that for any additional subobjects and properties they have added in their subclass.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleViewBase.Section508Compliant
member.summary: Determines whether compliance with U.S. Section 508 accessibility guidelines have been activated.

remarks.p: WebSchedule will render additional alternate text information and metadata to make the schedule more accessible to an audience that employs assistive technology such as braille readers or magnifiers in accordance with pertinent paragraphs of U.S. Section 508: 1194.22, "Accessibility in Web and Internet Applications."
Image properties allow you to customize the alternate text rendered when Section 508 compliance is active for interactive image elements, such as the and properties.

It is strongly recommended that when you activate Section 508 compliance that you also set to true to enable users to reach all information within the schedule view when a mouse is unavailable. By default, turning on one property does not force the other one to be turned on.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleViewBase.EnableKeyboardNavigation
member.summary: Determines whether the WebSchedule view element is accessible using the keyboard.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DayOrientedScheduleView.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default instance of the DayOrientedScheduleView.

remarks.p: This constructor is intended for use by inheritors only. Creating a standalone instance of DayOrientedScheduleView is not supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DayOrientedScheduleView.CreateControlStyle
member.summary: Overridden. Factory method called by the WebControl base class to get a specialized Style subclass from it's inheritors.
member.returns: A subclass of Style with enhanced properties for Infragistics' web elements.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DayOrientedScheduleView.CreateRenderer
member.summary: Initializes a DayOrientedScheduleViewRenderer associated with this element that assumes responsibility for creating a scene graph of user-interface elements and rendering (serializing) them to the end user.

remarks.p: The DayOrientedScheduleView overrides this method to provide the SmartWebControl infrastructure with a SmartRenderer that supports basic rendering and styling common to all day-oriented views of WebSchedule information.

Inheriting controls should implement this factory method to associate their own custom subclass with the DayOrientedScheduleView. A derived DayOrientedScheduleViewRenderer must know how to compose an appropriate scene graph for their day-oriented WebSchedule's presentation.
The CreateRenderer method will be invoked by the base SmartWebControl class when it first calls , which is usually (but not necessarily) during the PreRender stage of the page lifecycle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DayOrientedScheduleView.RenderContents(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders the contents of this DayOrientedScheduleView at the request of the base class.
member.param: An HtmlTextWriter with which to write HTML markup to.

remarks.p: The SmartWebControl base class calls this method in response to the ASP.NET Framework requesting all web elements on a Page to render themselves. Any overriding implementation of this method does not need to call the base implementation so long as they dispatch the call to RenderContents on their associated SmartRenderer.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for more specialized rendering contexts.

remarks.p: RenderContextBase contains the essential information common to all rendering contexts. A rendering context exists to mediate any implementation-specific settings of a SmartWebControl into those that are required by it's UIElements to render. The rendering context is the contract describing what information must be shared between a SmartWebControl and the UIElements in it's scene graph. Through this decoupling, the same UIElements can be reused with a different SmartWebControl so long as it can map it's own implementation-specific settings to those required by the UIElements to render themselves.
Inheritors must call the base class setters for and from their constructor(s) to properly initialize the RenderContextBase's SmartWebControl and SmartRenderer, respectively.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default instance of the RenderContextBase for use by inheritors.

remarks.p: The base class default constructor initializes the and properties to null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET). Inheritors must set these properties from within their subclass' constructors in order for the RenderContextBase class to become properly initialized.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase.ImageUrlToPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified image filename mapped to the image directory path defined by the SmartWebControl.
member.param: The filename and extension of the image file to be resolved.
member.returns: An image URL containing a qualified path that has been mapped based on whether it is relative, or based off of the default image directory path information specified from the web.config file.

remarks.p: UIElements may use this method when they need to render the SRC attribute of an HTML tag.

member.exception: Thrown when the was not properly initialized by the subclass.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase.View
member.summary: Gets or sets the SmartWebControl which defines the information model required by the scene graph to render a view to the end user.
member.value: An instance of SmartWebControl, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if uninitialized.

remarks.p: Inheritors must initialize this to their custom SmartWebControl subclass from within their own custom rendering context that is derived from RenderContextBase.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the SmartRenderer which provides services required by the scene graph to render a view to the end user.
member.value: An instance of SmartRenderer, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if uninitialized.

remarks.p: Inheritors must initialize this to their custom SmartRenderer subclass from within their own custom rendering context that is derived from RenderContextBase.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase.ImageDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the image directory used for image source resolution during rendering.
member.value: The image directory under which image files can be found.

remarks.p: This value defaults to the ImageDirectory on the SmartWebControl associated with this RenderContextBase through . When set, the RenderContextBase caches the value and returns that in response to future requests instead. This copy-on-write cache ensures the ImageDirectory on the SmartWebControl is not inadvertantly modified by rendering code.

member.exception: Thrown when the View property has not been properly initialized by the subclass in it's constructor before the ImageDirectory property is first read.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase.IsFirefox
member.summary: Indicates whether the browser being rendered to is Firefox.
member.value: True if the browser detected by was Firefox; false otherwise.

remarks.p: Rendering logic must sometimes render conditional markup or attributes when Firefox is detected as the browser.

member.exception: Thrown when the View property has not been properly initialized by the subclass in it's constructor before the IsFirefox property is first read.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RenderContextBase.IsNetscape
member.summary: Indicates whether the browser being rendered to is Netscape.
member.value: True if the browser detected by was Netscape; false otherwise.

remarks.p: Rendering logic must sometimes render conditional markup or attributes when Netscape is detected as the browser.

member.exception: Thrown when the View property has not been properly initialized by the subclass in it's constructor before the IsNetscape property is first read.

Additional activity states not related to reminder notifications may be possible, and are reserved for future use.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.SnoozePersistenceType
member.summary: Enumeration of persistence methods for the snooze behavior of WebSchedule.

remarks.p: The choice of a snooze persistence type may have an effect on the reliability of reminder notifications. For instance, a persistence type managed through HTTP cookies will not function for end users whose browsers routinely do not accept cookies. Cookies are further distinguished by ASP.NET session, which is subject to an expiration timeout that may (and often is) shorter than the snooze time period.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.SnoozePersistenceType.Cookie
member.summary: Snooze information shall be stored in HTTP cookies.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.SnoozePersistenceType.ControlState
member.summary: Snooze information shall be stored in the Control's state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendar.EnableAppStyling
member.summary: Enables support on WebCalendar for the Application Styling Framework(tm).
member.value: True indicates Application Styling is enabled, False indicates Application Styling is disabled, and NotSet indicates support for Application Styling should default to page- or application-level settings.

remarks.p: Turn on support for Application Styling of WebCalendar when using the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to True.

When EnableAppStyling has it's default value of NotSet, this control will defer the determination of whether to use Application Styling to settings you make at the page- or application-level. Place the WebPage control on the same Web form as this control to configure ASF support for all controls on that Page. ASF support can also be turned on application-wide with the enableAppStyling attribute in your "web.config" file.
Turn off support for the ASF in WebCalendar (even though it may have been enabled at a higher level) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendar.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this WebCalendar control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this WebCalendar control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igtr_AquaNode" and "igtr_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendar.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents
member.summary: Manages the names of custom event handler functions called by Javascript on the client-side.

remarks.p: Because of the stateless nature of web connections, and the typical delays involved in retrieving information from a server, WebSchedule implements both client-side events and server-side events. Applications can choose whether they would like to respond to client-side events, which must be written in Javascript.

The CalendarClientSideEvents object maintains a list of event handlers that are implemented on the client and called in response to events as they occur in the browser. Each event is a string that represents JavaScript function name. The named function must be implemented by the developer in JavaScript code.

Most Javascript event handler functions will receive three arguments (the InitializeCalendar event receives only one argument.) The first parameter contains a reference to the Javascript object representing the Calendar CSOM object. The second parameter typically contains a Javascript Date object. The third parameter contains a reference to the CSOM object representing the event. See the events' descriptions for more details.

member.summary: Default public constructor for the CalendarClientSideEvents object.

remarks.p: The ASP.NET Framework requires this constructor when it must deserialize compound properties on starting up an ASP.NET page request. Application developers should not need to create their own instance of this class.

member.summary: Event fired after Calendar was initialized.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 1 parameter.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents.DateClicked
member.summary: Event fired when the selected date was clicked.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: clicked Date.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents.MonthChanged
member.summary: Event fired after the visible month was changed.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: visible Date.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents.MonthChanging
member.summary: Event fired before the visible month is changed. This event can be canceled.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: visible Date.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject. To cancel event the cancel member should be used. Following example will prevent viewing any month of 2008 year.
if(oDate.getFullYear() == 2008) oEvent.cancel = true;

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents.ValueChanged
member.summary: Event fired when the selected date was changed.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: selected Date.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents.ValueChanging
member.summary: Event fired before the selected date was changed. This event can be canceled.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: selected Date.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject. To cancel this event the cancel member should be used. Following example will prevent selecting 10th day in any month.
if(oDate.getDate() == 10) oEvent.cancel = true;

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarClientSideEvents.RenderDay
member.summary: Event fired before the day is rendered. This event can be used to customize day painting.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: reference to the painted day. That parameter contains following member variables:
year - number: painted year.
month - number: painted month.
day - number: painted day of the month.
selected - boolean: true if painted day was selected.
dow - number: day of the week (0..6) of the painted day.
index - number: index of painted day within calendar <table>.
text - string: text to paint in the day, usually the day (this value can be modified.)
css - string: name of CSS class used for painting (this value can be modified by appending a custom CSS class separated by a space.)
element - object: reference to the <td> HTML element containing this painted day.
Following example will replace text in the first days of all months by the "1st" string:
if(oDay.day == 1) oDay.text = oDay.text + 'st';
Following example will paint all Saturdays by italic font:
if(oDay.dow == 6) oDay.element.style.fontStyle = 'italic';
Following example will paint January 1st of any year by red background:
oDay.element.bgColor = (oDay.day == 1 && oDay.month == 1) ? 'red' : '';
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CalendarLayout.Culture
member.summary: The property of the object is used by the control.

remarks.p:
The Culture property allows you to customize all aspects of the format that is applied to a DateTime object while converting it to a string. Those format properties include field separators, date/time patterns, names of months, etc.
If the value is not set, then the object is used.
That property also affects the WebDateChooser. Abbriviated month names in edit mode are not supported and months are converted to digits. Only the Gregorian calendar is supported.

summary.p: The ClientSideEvents object contains string properties that allow client-side JavaScript function names to be specified for handling a variety of events that occur on the client. The JavaScript function with the same name must then be defined somewhere within the page in order for the event to be fired.
The JavaScript can be written directly into the aspx page or it can be added in the code-behind file using the Page.RegisterClientScriptBlock function.

member.returns: True: ViewState.Count > 0

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDropDown.ClientSideEvents.ValueChanged

summary.p: The ValueChanged event will fire when the value of the dropdown is changed. If the textbox is changed directly, this event will not fire until the control loses focus.

member.remarks:
It can be the name of an implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of the function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebDateChooser object.
2nd parameter: new value.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

summary.p: The TextChanged event will fire when the textbox portion of the control is directly edited.

member.remarks:
It can be the name of an implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of the function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebDateChooser object.
2nd parameter: new text.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

1st parameter: reference to the WebDateChooser object.
2nd parameter: reference to the drop-down panel which contains the calendar.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

summary.p: The WebDropDown control is a multi-column, editable drop-down selection control. It allows users to choose values from a displayed list of items that is shown when the arrow in the control is clicked.
The drop-down area of WebDropDown is based on the WebGrid control and supports many of the features of it. Column and row sizing, sorting, row selectors are supported within the drop-down.
If values in addition to the list are possible for the field, the WebDropDown can be set to Editable so that values can be directly typed in to the top value of the control.
WebDropDown can also be used from within WebGrid to display valuelists inside of grid cells.

summary.p: Returns the ExpandEffects object that determines the type of filters and transitions that will be used when displaying sub menus under IE 5 and above.

The ClientSideEvents object maintains the names of JavaScript functions that are to be called on the client side in response to various events that can be processed without the need for a server post-back.
Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not Select dropdown controls will be automatically hidden when submenus are being displayed.
When this property is set to true, all select controls in the page document are hidden until the popup menus are dismissed.

remarks.p: This functionality is necessary due to the problematic way that Internet Explorer implements the Select DropDown control. Netscape 6+ handles this situation properly and the hiding of dropdowns is not necessary.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.EnableKeyboardNavigation

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.EnableAppStyling
member.summary: Enables support on WebDateChooser for the Application Styling Framework(tm).
member.value: True indicates Application Styling is enabled, False indicates Application Styling is disabled, and NotSet indicates support for Application Styling should default to page- or application-level settings.

remarks.p: Turn on support for Application Styling of WebDateChooser when using the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to True.

When EnableAppStyling has it's default value of NotSet, this control will defer the determination of whether to use Application Styling to settings you make at the page- or application-level. Place the WebPage control on the same Web form as this control to configure ASF support for all controls on that Page. ASF support can also be turned on application-wide with the enableAppStyling attribute in your "web.config" file.
Turn off support for the ASF in WebDateChooser (even though it may have been enabled at a higher level) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this WebDateChooser control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this WebDateChooser control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igtr_AquaNode" and "igtr_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooser.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.InvalidDateEntered

summary.p: This event is fired when an invalid value has been entered into the DateChooser.

member.remarks:
This event will be fired for 3 distinct cases. The first case would be a date entered that is non in the range of MinDate - MaxDate values set for the control. The second case would be when a null value is entered, but AllowNull is set to false. The last case would be an improperly formatted date string. This could occur of the month "13" was entered, etc.
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebDateChooser object.
2nd parameter: reference to object that contains properties related to invalid event.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarMonthChanging
member.summary: Event fired before the visible month in the calendar is changed. This event can be canceled.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of an implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of the function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: visible Date.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject. To cancel an event the cancel member should be used. The following example will prevent viewing any month of the year 2008.
if(oDate.getFullYear() == 2008) oEvent.cancel = true;

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarValueChanged

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarValueChanging
member.summary: Event fired before the selected date in the calendar was changed. This event can be canceled.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: selected Date.
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject. To cancel this event the cancel member should be used. Following example will prevent selecting 10th day in any month.
if(oDate.getDate() == 10) oEvent.cancel = true;

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDateChooserClientSideEvents.CalendarRenderDay
member.summary: Event fired before day in calendar is rendered. This event can be used to customize day painting.
member.remarks:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter: reference to the WebCalendar object.
2nd parameter: reference to the painted day. That parameter contains following member variables:
year - number: painted year.
month - number: painted month.
day - number: painted day of the month.
selected - boolean: true if painted day was selected.
dow - number: day of the week (0..6) of the painted day.
index - number: index of painted day within calendar <table>.
text - string: text to paint in the day, usually the day (this value can be modified.)
css - string: name of CSS class used for painting (this value can be modified by appending a custom CSS class separated by a space.)
element - object: reference to the <td> HTML element containing this painted day.
Following example will replace text in the first days of all months by the "1st" string:
if(oDay.day == 1) oDay.text = oDay.text + 'st';
Following example will paint all Saturdays by italic font:
if(oDay.dow == 6) oDay.element.style.fontStyle = 'italic';
Following example will paint January 1st of any year by red background:
oDay.element.bgColor = (oDay.day == 1 && oDay.month == 1) ? 'red' : '';
3rd parameter: reference to the ig_EventObject.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Appointment
member.summary: Represents an appointment activity for a specific date and time. This class inherits most of its behavior and functionality from the Activity object. The specific properties added by the Appointment object are: Subject, Location and Description.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity
member.summary: Represents an Activity for a specific date and time.

remarks.p: An Activity object maintains information regarding a event or task for a particular date and time. The start and end of the Activity are stored in the or respectively. To change the start of the Activity without changing the duration, use the method.

The property may be used to indicate that an Activity occurs on a day or range of days but is not restricted to a particular time within those days. By default, Activities are rendered differently than non-AllDayEvent Activities. The appearance of all AllDayEvent type Activities can be adjusted by changing the . The can be used to change the style for all Activities. The style of an Activity can also be controlled on an individual basis by adjusting its

A new Activity, can be created by either creating a new instance of an and adding it to the collection or using the method of the collection. An Activity can also be created using the . To display the AppointmentDialog for a new Activity, use the . The overload may be used to display the Activity information for an existing Activity.
An Activity can have a associated with it. When the is reached, the will be displayed if enabled.

member.summary: Indicates the Status of the Activity. Normal Status means that the Activity's due date has not yet arrived. Expired indicates that the due date of the Activity has arrived and that the Resource that owns the Activity has been notified via the firing of an event.

member.summary: Returns or sets the original start date/time of the in a recurring series.
member.value: Returns a that formerly was the start time for this occurrence of a recurring activity in Universal Time, or returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if this activity is not a variance.

remarks.p: This property gets set to the StartDateTimeUtc of the activity when a variance is created. Variances describe exceptions or special cases in a recurring series of activities. This property is read only for applications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.VarianceKey
member.summary: Returns the globally-unique identifier (GUID) that correlates the current Activity with that of it's variances.

remarks.p: This property supports the data-binding of a recurring Activity with it's set of variances. The WebSchedule data provider will initialize this value, and it must be left unchanged by applications. The same identifier value should be written to the data source when the Activity is saved.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.Style
member.summary: Returns or sets the object that controls the Activity's formatting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.HasStyle
member.summary: Indicates whether a object has been created.
member.value: Returns true when the Style object for the property has been created.

remarks.p: Use this property to determine if an object has been created. Style objects in general are not created until the properties associated with them are accessed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.ScheduleInfo
member.summary: Gets the WebScheduleInfo element owning this Activity object.
member.value: A reference to the owning WebScheduleInfo element on the page, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if the Activity hasn't been initialized with an owning WebScheduleInfo at this point.

remarks.p: If the current object is un-owned, then an application may assign a non-null to it for initialization purposes (for example, during data binding). An Activity requires a non-null WebScheduleInfo owner for it's properties to default their values to correctly, otherwise the error message "Object reference not set to an instance of an object" may appear when accessing properties dependent on WebScheduleInfo.

member.exception: Thrown if the ScheduleInfo property is assigned a different owner after already having been initialized. Check the property before assigning a WebScheduleInfo to avoid making this error.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.HasScheduleInfo
member.summary: Indicates whether the property has been initialized on the current Activity to a WebScheduleInfo owner.
member.value: True if the Activity has had it's WebScheduleInfo initialized; otherwise False if the Activity is unassigned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.IsSelected
member.summary: Indicates whether the is selected.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.Visible
member.summary: Determines whether the can be displayed.
member.value: Returns true if the Activity can be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.Recurrence
member.summary: Gets/sets the object that describes the recurrence pattern that determines the frequency at which individual occurrences occur.

remarks.p: Only objects that are the of an will return a non-null value from this property; 'standalone' appointments and variances (members of a recurrence that have been modified) both return null from this property.

Note: Attempting to set the Recurrence property of an Appointment that is a member of an existing object’s collection will result in an exception being thrown. Similarly, assigning an object that is already assigned to some other object’s Recurrence property results in an exception being thrown. Also note that setting the or property of an whose Recurrence property is set will result in an exception being thrown.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.RecurrenceKey
member.summary: Gets/sets the key of the assigned Recurrence.
member.value: The key of the Recurrence, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if there is no recurrence associated with this Activity.

remarks.p: Nonrecurring activities will return null (or Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) from this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.Kind
member.summary: Sets or gets a value that signifies the type and role that this Activity plays. Possible values are: StandAlone, RecurrenceRoot, Variance, Occurrence.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.IsMultiDay
member.summary: Determines whether the Activity spans multiple days (read-only).
member.returns: True if the start date and end date are different except when the end time is 12:00 midnight on the day following the start date.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.ResourceKey
member.summary: Gets/sets the key of the assigned Resource.
member.value: The key of the Resource, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if none.

remarks.p: Activities that are unassigned will return null (or Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) from this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.Resource
member.summary: Gets/sets the Resource associated with this Activity as it's organizer.
member.value: A Resource instance based on the .

remarks.p: Developers are encouraged to use when checking whether the Activity has been assigned a Resource or not.
Accessing the Resource before the DataBind method has been called on to fill it's ResourcesCollection leads to undefined behavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.HasResource
member.summary: Indicates whether this Activity has an organizing Resource.
member.value: True if the Activity has an organizing Resource; otherwise False if it has no Resource (it was associated with the UnassignedResource instance) or no resources have been loaded.

remarks.p: The HasResource property will notably return False if checked prior to DataBind being called on . This may be a false indication, but the Resource can only be made available after the VisibleResources collection has been populated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.VisibleResolved
member.summary: Returns false if either this Activity's Visible property is false or it's Resource's Visible property is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.EnableReminder
member.summary: Determines whether the is enabled.
member.value: Returns true if the Reminder is enabled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.ReminderInterval
member.summary: Determines the length of time before an activity is due that the reminder dialog is displayed.
member.value: A TimeSpan object that contains the length of time value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.Importance
member.summary: Indicates if the Activity is of High, Medium or Low Importance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.ShowTimeAs
member.summary: Indicates how the Activity should be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity.EnableReminderResolved
member.summary: Indicates whether a reminder notification will be displayed for an Activity.
member.value: True if after evaluating all reminder enablements, a reminder notification is supposed to be given; otherwise False when one or more criteria for issuing a reminder notification are not met (see the Remarks below for details).

remarks.p: A reminder notification might not be displayed because: the WebScheduleInfo has turned off reminders (see EnableReminders), the Resource organizing the activity has turned off reminders, this Activity has had it's reminder disabled (see ), the ActiveResourceName doesn't match the LoggedOnUserName on the WebScheduleInfo, or the reminder has already been dismissed (it has expired, see for more information).

After a reminder has expired, it will no longer display the reminder icon next to the activity, even though EnableReminder contains a true value on the Activity (and it's checkbox will appear checked in the Edit Appointment dialog).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendarView.GetResourceCss(System.String)
member.summary:
Get embedded css. If control supports embedded StyleSheets, then it should override this method.
If cssStyleSheetName represents embedded css, then control should return value of the first param in the WebResourceAttribute with which that CSS-file was linked to. If control supports multiple embedded css, then besides empty-string it also should process other values of cssStyleSheetName param. For multiple CSSes the logic may assume syntax: "[nameOfFileOrPreset]", where "[" flag for embedded resource and "nameOfFileOrPreset" is short name of embedded file of a flag for particular preset. It also should validate for explicit path like "Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CSS.Default.ig_webdayview.css"
member.param: The value of this.StyleSheetFileName property.
member.returns: Control must return null if cssStyleSheetName is not an embedded resource.

member.summary: Event fired after initialization of client side object that represents WebCalendarView.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendarViewClientEvents.Navigate
member.summary: Event fired when navigation was triggered by previous/next/today button or when month/year was selected from drop-down lists.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client JavaScript may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the WebCalendarView object
2nd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
3rd parameter is visible date
This event can be canceled by "oEvent.cancel = true;".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebCalendarViewClientEvents.RenderDay
member.summary: Event fired when a day in the calendar is rendered. Applications may modify the appearance of the day and its content dynamically on the client.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client JavaScript may contain 3 parameters.
The 1st parameter contains reference to the WebCalendarView object.
The 2nd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object.
The 3rd parameter is painted day. It contains member variables that provide information about painted date, type of day, text, style, etc.
If that event is canceled by oEvent.cancel=true; then default rendering logic is not applied.

2nd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
3rd parameter contains reference to the element which gets that event

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.GetResourceCss(System.String)
member.summary:
Get embedded css. If control supports embedded StyleSheets, then it should override this method.
If cssStyleSheetName represents embedded css, then control should return value of the first param in the WebResourceAttribute with which that CSS-file was linked to. If control supports multiple embedded css, then besides empty-string it also should process other values of cssStyleSheetName param. For multiple CSSes the logic may assume syntax: "[nameOfFileOrPreset]", where "[" flag for embedded resource and "nameOfFileOrPreset" is short name of embedded file of a flag for particular preset. It also should validate for explicit path like "Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CSS.Default.ig_webdayview.css"
member.param: The value of this.StyleSheetFileName property.
member.returns: Control must return null if cssStyleSheetName is not an embedded resource.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.ActivityHeightMinimum
member.summary: The minimum height of appointment in pixels.

remarks.p: Note: If value is zero, then the height of a TimeSlot row is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.ActivityWidthMinimum
member.summary: The minimum width of appointment in pixels.

remarks.p: Note: That property will have effect only when multiple appointments are assigned to a particular time slot and calculated widths of those appointments become too small.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.TimeSlotLabelType
member.summary: Determines how often the Time Slot Descriptor labels are displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.ScrollPosition
member.summary: Vertical scroll in pixels. Negative value will scroll WebDayView to the first working time slot.

remarks.p: Note: That property has effect only at run time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.TimeDisplayFormat
member.summary: Determines how times are displayed: 0 = Time12Hour (hh:mm AM/PM) 1 = Time24Hour (HH:mm) 2 = Default

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.AppointmentFormatString
member.summary: The format string used to build text for an appointment.

remarks.p:
Notes: That property may include literal characters and replacement-string flags which are defined as "FormatTag_Xxxx" constants in WebScheduleInfo class.
Literal part of format is used as it is and passed directly to html.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayView.AppointmentTooltipFormatString
member.summary: The format string used to build text for the tooltip of an appointment.

remarks.p: Notes: That property may include literal characters and replacement-string flags which are defined as "FormatTag_Xxxx" constants in WebScheduleInfo class. Literal part of format is passed directly to the "title" attribute of html-element with exception of " " flag which is replaced by the new-line character.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebDayViewClientEvents.NavigateNext
member.summary: Event fired when navigation button on the right side of contol was clicked.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client JavaScript may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the WebDayView object
2nd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
3rd parameter is number of days to navigate from current active date
This event can be canceled by "oEvent.cancel = true;".

1st parameter contains reference to the WebDayView object
2nd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
3rd parameter is number of days to navigate from current active date
This event can be canceled by "oEvent.cancel = true;".

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthViewCompressedDay.ShouldRenderChild(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Render.UIElement)
member.summary: Determines whether a particular child UIElement should have Render called upon it by the base class' implementation of Render.
member.param: The child UIElement.
member.returns: This method always returns True when child is not null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET); inheritors may override this implementation when providing custom logic to filter out certain child UIElements from being rendered by returning False when such conditions are met.

remarks.p: Inheritors should call the base implementation, and logically-AND the result of that call with the boolean result of their own custom processing. This ensures that a NullReferenceException doesn't occur because the base class' check of whether this child UIElement was null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) was overridden.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView
member.summary: The WebMonthView element is a day-oriented view on WebSchedule presenting a calendar month of information at a time to the end user.

remarks.p: The WebMonthView exposes a broad variety of customizable styles affecting its appearance. These styles control the appearance of the days, day headings and day of week headings in the current month, the leading and trailing days of neighboring months that may be visible (typically shown with a 'grayed' out look) within the month view, and the appearance of months every other (alternating) month from the active month.

Initialize the WebMonthView to collaborate with other WebSchedule views on the same Page by setting its ScheduleInfo property to a common instance of the scheduling information element also on the Page that is shared with these other views. Alternately, each WebSchedule view may operate independently based on a default instance it initializes its ScheduleInfo property to, and which developers may customize by altering the ScheduleInfo through an instance of the WebMonthView element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default instance of the WebMonthView.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.InitializeStyles
member.summary: Used to initialize styles at design time to their default internal values when EnableAppStyling has been set to false. This method is for internal use only

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.OnInit(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when the Init event is fired on the WebMonthView control.
member.param: Not used.

remarks.p: This overloaded method permits the WebMonthView control to listen for events fired by it's abstract base class when a new WebScheduleInfo control is connected.
Inheritors overriding this method must call this base class's implementation of OnInit.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.CreateSubObject(System.String)
member.summary: Creates sub-objects.
member.param: The string identifier for the property.
member.returns: An IStateManager implementation for the property.

remarks.p: A sub-object is an expandable or "compound" property responsible for its own state management (cf, viewstate) and must implement IStateManager. All sub-objects on the WebMonthView are Styles.

The WebControlBase class calls the override of this method when required, in reaction to calls to SetSubObject and GetSubObject. It should not be necessary for inheritors to ever invoke this method directly.

Inheritors adding additional properties that meet the definition of a sub-object should override this method if they wish to take advantage of the WebControlBase support for viewstate management. Subclasses are free to provide state management through alternative means for properties they add, as they see fit. If this method is overridden, inheritors must call the base implementation when an id is unrecognized.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.OnRaisePostBackEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Triggers server-side events and behaviors on the WebMonthView element.
member.param: Command information passed from the call the client-side script makes through fireServerEvent. This text has no relationship to the similarly-named System.EventArgs class.

remarks.p: This method gets invoked by the framework and is responsible for handling server-side events. Inheritors should not override this method to intercept server-side events before they are handled by the base class. Undefined behavior may result from interference in the event processing of the framework.
Consequently, developers that want to receive notification of an event should subscribe an event handler to the server-side events formally exposed by WebMonthView.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.CreateRenderer
member.summary: Creates a SmartRenderer of the appropriate type for the WebMonthView.
member.returns: An instance of WebMonthViewRenderer providing the rendering services required by the WebMonthView.

remarks.p: The SmartWebControl framework calls this factory method before it begins using the SmartRenderer subclass for this web element. Inheritors with their own custom SmartRenderer must override this method to see it used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.OnPreRender(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Performs pre-render processing.
member.param: Event arguments passed-in by the ASP.NET Framework during the PreRender stage of the page lifecycle.

remarks.p: Inheritors overriding this method must call the base class implementation. Failure to call the base implementation can lead to Javascript errors resulting from omitting <include> blocks, a loss of styling from the element, and other undesirable behavior.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.RenderContents(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders contents to the supplied HtmlTextWriter.
member.param: An HtmlTextWriter sink to which output is being directed.

remarks.p: The contents associated with the WebMonthView and rendered by this method include fields to hold postback data from the client, and initialization Javascript to start-up the WebMonthView's client-side object model (CSOM) following the HTML markup comprising the element. RenderContents delegates responsibility for rendering HTML markup to the associated SmartRenderer created by .
Inheritors overriding this method must remember to call the base class implementation of the method before conducting most additional processing.

Post-processing of the rendered content can be accomplished if inheritors intercept what gets written to writer. This involves passing their own HtmlTextWriter wrapping some sort of buffered output sink, for example a StringWriter. When intercepting rendered content in this manner, it becomes the responsibility of the overriding method to ensure necessary content gets forwarded to the original HtmlTextWriter supplied by ASP.NET.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebMonthView.GetResourceCss(System.String)
member.summary:
Get embedded css. If control supports embedded StyleSheets, then it should override this method.
If cssStyleSheetName represents embedded css, then control should return value of the first param in the WebResourceAttribute with which that CSS-file was linked to. If control supports multiple embedded css, then besides empty-string it also should process other values of cssStyleSheetName param. For multiple CSSes the logic may assume syntax: "[nameOfFileOrPreset]", where "[" flag for embedded resource and "nameOfFileOrPreset" is short name of embedded file of a flag for particular preset. It also should validate for explicit path like "Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CSS.Default.ig_webdayview.css"
member.param: The value of this.StyleSheetFileName property.
member.returns: Control must return null if cssStyleSheetName is not an embedded resource.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ActivitiesCollection
member.summary: A collection of objects.

remarks.p: The ActivitiesCollection contains a reference to all the objects for the object and can be accessed via the property.
The Activities associated with a particular time frame may be returned in an object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ActivitiesCollection.OnInsertComplete(System.Int32,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.WebObjectBase)
member.summary: Receives a notification from the base collection when an Activity has been added or inserted.
member.param: The index at which the Activity was inserted (zero-based).
An object reference to the Activity.

remarks.p: This notification allows inheritors extending the base collection class to react to insertions (additions) with follow-up processing.

Inheritors must call the base class implementation of this method before their own processing to ensure WebScheduleInfo (which holds a reference to this collection) can be properly informed of a change within the collection.

The index will be equal to the Count when an Activity was added instead of inserted (at any other position than the end of the collection). An Add and an Insert to the end of the collection are indistinguishable.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ActivitiesCollection.OnRemoveComplete(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Receives a notification from the base collection when an Activity has been removed.
member.param: The index at which the Activity was removed (zero-based).
An object reference to the Activity.

remarks.p: This notification allows inheritors extending the base collection class to react to removals with follow-up processing.

Inheritors must call the base class implementation of this method before their own processing to ensure WebScheduleInfo (which holds a reference to this collection) can be properly informed of a change within the collection.
This method is not called in response to a operation, even though a Clear is analogous to removing every item contained within the collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ActivitiesCollection.Add(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Activity)
member.summary: Adds a new into the collection.
member.param: Activity to add
member.returns: The added Activity

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ActivitiesCollection.Clear
member.summary: Clears the .

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ActivitiesCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the at the specified index from the collection.
member.param: Index of the in the collection to remove (zero-based).

remarks.p: Developers would use RemoveAt to remove an Activity (or any class extending Activity) from the ActivitiesCollection when they have the index of that Activity within the collection. If the application instead has the object reference to an instance of the Activity, then it should use .

Removing an Activity from the ActivitiesCollection does not cause the Activity to be removed from any persistence store (such as the database). The Activity will reappear on the next page request unless the caller also removes it from the persistence store (i.e., database).

member.exception: Thrown when the index specified exceeds the bounds of the ActivitiesCollection. For example, when RemoveAt(7) is called, and there are only four activities in the collection at indexes 0 through 3, then that would cause an ArgumentOutOfRangeException to be thrown.

member.summary: Removes the specified from the collection.
member.param: The instance to remove from this collection.

remarks.p: Developers would use Remove to remove an Activity (or any class extending Activity) from the ActivitiesCollection when they hold a reference to the object. If the application instead has the index, within this ActivitiesCollection, or the Activity then it should use .

Removing an Activity from the ActivitiesCollection does not cause the Activity to be removed from any persistence store (such as the database). The Activity will reappear on the next page request unless the caller also removes it from the persistence store (i.e., database).

member.exception: Thrown when the activity specified to be removed from the ActivitiesCollection is null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET). The caller must provide a non-null Activity instance that is a member of the collection for it to be removed.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.AppointmentVariance
member.summary: Represents an appointment for a specific date and time within a recurring appointment sequence.

remarks.p: An Appointment object maintains information regarding a task for a particular date and time. The start and end of the appointment are stored in the or respectively. To change the start of the appointment without changing the duration, use the method.

The property may be used to indicate that an Appointment occurs on a day or range of days but is not restricted to a particular time within those days. By default, appointments are rendered differently than non-AllDayEvent appointments. The appearance of all AllDayEvent type appointments can be adjusted by changing the . The can be used to change the appearance for all appointments. The appearance of an appointment can also be controlled on an individual basis by adjusting its

A new Appointment, can be created by either creating a new instance of an and adding it to the collection or using the method of the collection. An appointment can also be created using the . To display the AppointmentDialog for a new appointment, use the . The overload may be used to display the appointment information for an existing Appointment.
An Appointment can have a and associated with it. When the is reached, the will be displayed and the will be invoked as long as each is enabled.

member.summary: Gets/sets whether the has been logically removed.

remarks.p: The IsRemoved marks a member of a recurrence as having been logically removed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.AppointmentVariance.OriginalStartDateTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns or sets the original start date/time of the in a recurring series.
member.value: Returns a that formerly was the start time for this occurrence of a recurring activity in Universal Time, or returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if this activity is not a variance.

remarks.p: This property gets set to the StartDateTimeUtc of the activity when a variance is created. Variances describe exceptions or special cases in a recurring series of activities. This property is read only for applications.
