member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DataContext
member.summary: Abstract base class containing parameters pertaining to data-related operations in general.

remarks.p: Objects extending DataContext are created by WebScheduleInfo and passed to the WebSchedule data providers during data binding operations. The context information specified by each DataContext subclass is particular to an operation having to do with the storage/retrieval of one or more WebSchedule objects to/from the data source. Passing this information encapsulated within one argument simplifies the method signature of a data provider's operations, and facilitates the use of remote data sources.

The DataContext base class specifies an which all inheritors should set to their intended operation. Failure to identify the intended operation of a DataContext will cause the IDataFetch and/or IDataUpdate interfaces on a WebSchedule data provider to throw an ArgumentException.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DataContext.Operation
member.summary: Defines the type of data operation that this context supports.
member.value: The name of the operation performed, following the convention of starting with a verb ("Fetch", "Update", "Add", "Remove") and ending with a noun ("Activity", "Resource", "Reminder").

remarks.p: Inheritors should set this property within the constructor of their DataContext subclass. The standard implementation of IDataFetch and IDataUpdate on WebScheduleDataProviderBase will use the operation to dispatch the DataContext to the appropriate method during data binding.

If the operation name is not recognized by the implementation of IDataFetch and IDataUpdate, then an ArgumentException may be thrown by the data provider. Developers creating their own custom data provider through inheritance may override the implementation of those interface methods with their own, to route custom DataContext subclasses to their own operations. See the documentation on creating custom data providers for further information.

This DataContext carries parameter values pertinent to the update of an existing resource, which is somebody (or something) for which activities can be scheduled. It corresponds to the operation named "UpdateResource".

exception.p: Thrown when resource has no Name (it is either null or String.Empty). All resources must have a Name that is unique within the data store, allowing them to be referenced.

Thrown when resource identifies the Unassigned resource. Changes are not permitted to the row of default data describing the Unassigned resource, because it could compromise the integrity of the WebSchedule data model.

member.exception: Thrown when resource is null (or Nothing in Visual Basic .NET). A non-null instance of a Resource is required to read and copy the modified property values in that resource to the data store.

The context information specified by each DataContext subclass is particular to an operation having to do with the storage/retrieval of one or more WebSchedule objects to/from the data source. This DataContext carries parameter values pertinent to the updating of snooze information for the current end user. It corresponds to the operation named "UpdateSnooze".

Unlike other data operations, the backing store for snooze information is determined by the SnoozePersistenceType on the WebScheduleDataProviderBase. Currently supported storage methods are Cookie and ControlState.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UpdateRemindersContext.LastReminderStartDateTimeUtc
member.summary: Start date/time of a recurring activity occurrence that was dismissed.
member.value: The start date/time (in Universal Time) of the last occurrence to have dismissed it's reminder notification, or DateTime.MinValue when not applicable.

remarks.p: The data provider may not store (and therefore it may not assign a unique DataKey to) recurring activity occurrences. In order to represent dismissal of a recurring occurrence's reminder, the client Reminder dialog posts back the DataKey of the root Activity for the recurrence and the StartDateTimeUtc of the particular occurrence having the dismissed reminder.

Data providers that do not store all occurrences can support reminders for the next unreminded occurrence by using this date/time to update the Recurrence object's LastReminderStartDateTimeUtc property. On subsequent requests, reminders are not produced for occurrences on or before this date/time.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext
member.summary: Parameters pertaining to deletion of a variance from the data source.

remarks.p: Objects extending are created by WebScheduleInfo and passed to the WebSchedule data providers during data binding operations. The context information specified by each DataContext subclass is particular to an operation having to do with the storage/retrieval of one or more WebSchedule objects to/from the data source. Passing this information encapsulated within one argument simplifies the method signature of a data provider's operations, and facilitates the use of remote data sources.
This DataContext carries parameter values pertinent to the deletion of a recurring activity variance by the end user. It corresponds to the operation named "RemoveVariance".
If you have removed an Activity, then all variances are automatically removed with it and removing Variances individually becomes unnecessary.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.SmartDate)
member.summary: Creates a DataContext for a RemoveVariance operation of a recurring Activity's variance information.
member.param: Data key of a Variance related to an Activity to have it's information marked as deleted.

Data key of a root recurring Activity to which this variance belongs. May be the same as dataKey provided an originalStartDateTimeUtc is specified and this is supported by the WebSchedule data provider.
Data key of the Recurrence attached to the Variance to be deleted. This can be optionally used by the WebSchedule data provider to locate the variance's root Activity.
Original start date/time of the variance. This is only necessary to uniquely qualify a variance when the dataKey and rootActivityKey are identical.

remarks.p: The WebSchedule data model gives each variance row it's own unique dataKey distinct from it's parent (or containing) rootActivityKey. The built-in WebSchedule data providers may ignore the originalStartDateTimeUtc argument.

member.exception: Thrown when either dataKey, rootActivityKey, or recurrenceKey are supplied as null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) or empty strings. Both values are required to remove an instance of the variance.

Thrown when either dataKey, rootActivityKey, or recurrenceKey do not represent a numeric value, or when the value -999 is supplied. Non-default keys are required to remove an instance of the variance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Creates a DataContext for a RemoveVariance operation of a recurring Activity's variance information when the recurring series has changed.
member.param: Root Activity data key.
Variance correlation data key.

remarks.p: When the recurring series on an Activity changes, all variances must be deleted in the clean-up operation and the root Activity must have it's variance correlation key reset to the empty GUID.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext.RootActivityKey
member.summary: The variance is removed from the root recurring Activity identified by this key value.

remarks.p: When the last variance is removed from a root recurring Activity, a WebSchedule data provider may nullify the VarianceKey column to return the root to it's original state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext.RootActivityTimestamp
member.summary: Timestamp on the root recurring Activity, if it was updated by a stored procedure.
member.value: Variant object filled in by the data source's timestamp data. When this value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) the timestamp data is assumed to be unchanged.

remarks.p: The data provider populates the root Activity timestamp property when a stored procedure has updated it's timestamp of the root Activity in the data source. Code calling Update with a should check whether this value is not null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET). When a timestamp is updated by the data provider, it must be saved on the root Activity in order to avoid a subsequent concurrency conflict if that root Activity is later modified during this session.
When the RootActivityTimestamp is unset by the data provider, the calling code does not need to do anything.

The stored procedure used for removing all variances (when the flag is True) clears the variance key from the root Activity row. The in-memory root Activity object also has it's variance key cleared, which synchronizes both copies of the root Activity, except for the timestamp in the data source. This property permits a data provider to communicate an updated timestamp back to the calling code.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext.OriginalStartDateTimeUtc
member.summary: The original start date and time of the unmodified occurrence that has been replaced by this variance now being removed.

remarks.p: Not used by the built-in WebSchedule data providers.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext.IsDeleteAll
member.summary: Indicates whether all variances should be deleted because the recurring series has materially changed, and any existing variances are likely to become invalid.
member.value: True if all variances should be deleted; False if only an individual variance is to be marked as removed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.RemoveVarianceContext.VarianceKey
member.summary: Variance correlation key of a variance collection to be removed from the data provider.

remarks.p: Not used when is false.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.IDataFetch
member.summary: The IDataFetch interface supports general-purpose retrieval operations from arbitrary data sources.

remarks.p: Application developers will find their implementation of IDataFetch on one of the included WebSchedule data providers. Add a data provider (for example, WebScheduleSqlClientDataProvider when the application uses Microsoft SQL Server as it's database back-end) to the Page and set it's WebScheduleInfo property to point to the WebScheduleInfo used within your scheduling application. This will initialize the DataFetch property to a working implementation of IDataFetch, and it will be used when data binding to load activities, resources, reminders, and any other information.
Developers going so far as to create a custom data provider may find themselves implementing the operation, if not re-using the implementation provided by WebScheduleDataProviderBase.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.IDataFetch.Fetch(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DataContext)
member.summary: Fetches WebSchedule objects from the underlying data source.
member.param: A DataContext subclass containing parameter values for use when carrying out a fetch operation.

remarks.p: The implementation of Fetch will ordinarily examine the OperationName of the supplied context (parameters for the select or retrieval operation), and dispatch it to another method specifically designed for performing the requested operation.

In addition to naming the operation, the supplied DataContext will also encapsulate all of the information necessary to perform the operation. Examples of this sort of information would include key values, range boundaries, or any other material that would serve as criterion for the selection of information to return from the data source.

The included WebSchedule data providers already implement IDataFetch, so most developers do not need to contemplate implementing this interface unless they want to extend the functionality of the WebSchedule data model with their own custom data provider.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.IDataUpdate
member.summary: The IDataUpdate interface is used by WebScheduleInfo to communicate information to a data provider concerning the update operation to be performed and the relavant data required to carry it out. This interface is implemented by data providers and called by WebScheduleInfo when updates to the data source are required.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.IDataUpdate.Update(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.DataContext)
member.summary: Invokes an update operation on the data source. The type of operation is determined by the DataContext that is passed.
member.param: An object derived from DataContext. Specific DataContext objects used for updates include: UpdateActivitiyContext UpdateRemindersContext UpdateResourceContext UpdateSnoozeContext

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.RecurrenceId
member.summary: Gets a globally unique identifier that identifies this instance. Used for deserialization purposes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.DayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets/sets the number of the day in its respective month on which each occurrence will occur. Applicable only when the property is set to 'Monthly' or 'Yearly'.

remarks.p: Note: If the DayOfMonth property is set to a value that exceeds the number of days in any of the months that the recurrence spans, the occurrence for those months will fall on the last day of that month.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.DayOfWeekMaskUtc
member.summary: Gets/sets the day(s) of the week on which each occurrence occurs in UTC.

remarks.p: Note: The value of the DayOfWeekMaskUtc property is expressed as bitflags, so that multiple days can be represented by the property.
When the property is set to 'Daily', the DayOfWeekMaskUtc property can only be set to 'All' or 'AllWeekdays'; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception being thrown.
When the property is set to 'Weekly', the DayOfWeekMaskUtc property cannot be set to 'None'; doing so will result in an exception being thrown.
When the property is set to 'Monthly' or 'Yearly', the DayOfWeekMaskUtc property is not applicable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.DayOfWeekMask
member.summary: Gets/sets the day(s) of the week on which each occurrence occurs.

remarks.p: Note: The value of the DayOfWeekMask property is expressed as bitflags, so that multiple days can be represented by the property.
When the property is set to 'Daily', the DayOfWeekMask property can only be set to 'All' or 'AllWeekdays'; setting the property to any other value will result in an exception being thrown.
When the property is set to 'Weekly', the DayOfWeekMask property cannot be set to 'None'; doing so will result in an exception being thrown.
When the property is set to 'Monthly' or 'Yearly', the DayOfWeekMask property is not applicable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.Period
member.summary: Gets/sets the frequency at which the recurrence occurs, i.e., whether it occurs daily, weekly, monthly or yearly.

remarks.p: Note: Since certain values are not valid for the property when Period is set to 'Daily' or 'Weekly', the value of the property may be changed when Period is set to 'Daily' or 'Weekly'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.PeriodMultiple
member.summary: Gets/sets the interval between occurrences of the recurrence.

remarks.p: The PeriodMultiple property works in conjunction with the property to determine the cycle of the recurrence. For example, if the Period is set to 'Daily', and the PeriodMultiple is set to 2, the recurrence occurs every other day.
Note: The PeriodMultiple property is not applicable when the property is set to 'Yearly'. Also note that the maximum allowable value for the PeriodMultiple property is 99.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.MonthOfYear
member.summary: Gets/sets the month of the year on which individual occurrences will occur.

remarks.p: Note: The MonthOfYear property is only applicable when the property is set to 'Yearly'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.RecurrenceDayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the recurrence should occur on the first, second, third, fourth or last occurrence of the day of the week (corresponding to the value of the property) in its respective month.

remarks.p: Note: The RecurrenceDayOfMonth property is only applicable when the property is set to 'Monthly' or 'Yearly'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.EndDateUtc
member.summary: Gets/sets the date that defines the end of the recurrence.

remarks.p: Note:If MaxOccurrences is set after EndDateUtc, the original value you set for EndDateUtc, will be overridden.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.MaxOccurrences
member.summary: Gets/sets the maximum number of occurrences for the recurrence.

remarks.p: When you set the MaxOccurrences property there will be that many occurrences of the activity before the recurrence ends. The end date of the recurrence becomes based on this maximum number of occurrences, and the pattern describing when recurring activities must occur, instead of the property (which is ignored). It is important to set the PeriodMultiple to its expected value prior to setting the MaxOccurrences value in order for a new EndDate to be calculated correctly.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.StartDateUtc
member.summary: Gets the date that defines the beginning of the recurrence.

member.summary: Gets/sets whether the recurrence pattern is based on a specific day of the month and/or month of the year, or if it is calculated based on other criteria.

remarks.p: Note: The PatternType property is only applicable when the property is set to 'Monthly' or 'Yearly'.

member.summary: Returns the object that fully describes all occurrences (except for the date and start/end time) of 'non-variance' recurrences. This acts as a template that describes the subject, location, etc. of the recurrence.

remarks.p: The object referenced by the RootAppointment belongs to the collection. The property of an object that is a root appointment returns an instance of an object whereas all other types of s return null.

Note: Setting the or properties of an object that is assigned to an 's RootAppointment property will cause an exception to be thrown. To modify the starting time of an , set the property. To modify the duration of an , set the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.Description
member.summary: Returns the human-readable description of this instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.UtcOffset
member.summary: The UTC offset of when the Recurrence was created or last modified.

remarks.p: This represents the time span between UTC and the time zone of the user responsible for creating or last updating this Recurrence object. The property and others are sensitive to any time zone difference between the user who has set these property values and other users viewing the occurrences which result. The UtcOffset property can be used to clarify the intended meaning of these recurrence pattern properties.

For example, suppose a user in New York City (Eastern Standard Time, -5 hours from the Greenwich Meridian) creates a recurring activity scheduled for the last day of every month, starting on the last day of April at 10:00 PM local time. The root activity will be saved to the database with a UTC start date/time of 3:00 AM on the first day of May. The problem comes when a user in Frankfurt, Germany (Central European Time, +1 hour from the Greenwich Meridian) opens the schedule for this resource. For them, this "last day of every month" recurring activity would not take effect until 4:00 AM on the last day of May, because calendar month on the start date/time UTC is May and not April. What the user in Frankfurt should see is an occurrence at 4:00 AM local time on the first day of every month.

When the UtcOffset property on the Recurrence is properly set to a TimeSpan with a value of -5 hours to reflect the original user's intent that the recurrence pattern apply to the last day of month from the perspective of Eastern Standard Time, WebSchedule's recurrence engine makes the appropriate adjustment and produces an occurrence starting on the last day of April.

Failure to set the UtcOffset property may cause a global WebSchedule application to seemingly miss the first occurrence of a recurring series, and add an extra occurrence to the end of a recurring series, depending on the time zone of the end user. The WebSchedule user interface manages this for you, however when you create your own Recurrence objects programmatically, you must set the correct value on the UtcOffset property to match the current timezone UTC offset in which you want the recurrence created.

While the recurrence engine generates occurrences by accounting for the UtcOffset, the user interface will display the original property values on the Recurrence object. These may not match the expectations of users looking at the recurrence pattern from a different time zone. Using the above example, our user in Frankfurt would still see the Recurrence pattern as being a "last day of month" pattern, even though from their perspective the occurrences are always on the first day of the month.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Recurrence.LastReminderDateTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets/sets the date/time of the last reminder notification produced for an occurrence within this recurring series.

remarks.p: The LastReminderDateTimeUtc property is maintained by WebSchedule to generate a reminder, if applicable, for only the next occurrence after this date/time. It is defined as the date/time of the last occurrence for which a reminder was produced. Web applications should not need to change this property value unless reseting the occurrence for which the next reminder is given.

Advancing this date/time into the future supercedes the EnableReminder setting of any occurrences (or variances) that are bypassed. For example, a recurring bi-monthly series has enabled reminders and has occurrences scheduled for April 1, June 1, and August 1. When an application sets the LastReminderDateTimeUtc ahead to June 1, then no reminder notifications will be produced for the April 1 and June 1 occurrences. Their EnableReminder setting has been overriden by the behavior of the last reminder date/time.
This property has no impact when reminder notifications have been disabled.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Resource
member.summary: A Resource is an entity that owns or manages a series of Activities.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Resource.CreateSubObject(System.String)
member.summary: Creates property sub-objects of this Resource object.
member.param: A property identifier denoting the sub-object property.
member.returns: The IStateManager implementation of the sub-object property for delegation of viewstate management.

remarks.p: A property sub-object comprises any property having a complex type (for example, compound properties having their own sub-properties and collection properties). In the Infragistics Web infrastructure, sub-objects are responsible for implementing their own viewstate management behavior. The WebObjectBase class from which all Resource types derive will manage viewstate management for all properties having primitive values for which an overload of GetValue and SetValue exist and are used.

Inheritors deriving from the base Resource type who add their own property sub-objects should override this method, and retrieve the sub-object matching a property ID string they specify. Any unrecognized property ID string must be passed to the base class' implementation of this method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Resource.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default instance of Resource.

remarks.p: The created Resource is not part of any and does not belong to any WebScheduleInfo. It has no Key or Name (both default to String.Empty), therefore the developer is responsible for initializing these properties. Some default property values depending on having a WebScheduleInfo may not behave as expected if read (or written to) before the Resource gets initialized with a WebScheduleInfo.

Ordinarily, this default constructor supports serialization of Resource instances by the .NET Framework. Developers only need to instantiate Resource objects outside of their collection when they are working with them separate from the WebSchedule, or as part of some application of the Factory pattern (e.g., within a custom data provider).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.Resource.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets the key for this Resource that it is locally unique within it's containing ResourceCollection.

remarks.p: The Key is used to lookup and administer the Resource instance in it's collection, and is distinct from the which identifies the Resource in a user-friendly manner. For example, a Resource may have the Key 17, while having a more memorable Name such as "Bob."
The Key value -999 is reserved for use by the UnassignedResource, and cannot be specified for other resources in a scheduling application.

member.exception: Thrown when the key specified is reserved for use by the UnassignedResource only, or when attempting to modify the key of the UnassignedResource because the UnassignedResource is limited to a single entity that must always have it's reserved key.

remarks.p: This is the user-friendly name of the Resource. It is required to be unique so WebSchedule applications can specify the ActiveResourceName for the resource whose scheduling information is to be displayed. If the names of Resources are not unique within your organization, consider using the property for this purpose instead.
Note: This property corresponds to the [ResourceName] column in the WebSchedule data model, because "Name" is a reserved word in SQL.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ResourcePreference.EnableEmailReminders
member.summary: Indicates whether this Resource prefers to receive reminder notifications by electronic mail.

remarks.p: A WebSchedule application must separately deploy the "Reminder Web service" and "Reminder Notification by E-Mail Windows service" on an SMTP mail server in order to support delivery of reminders by electronic mail. See the documentation on these services for additional details.
Reminders sent by electronic mail do not count as being dismissed or snoozed when delivered, as an on-line reminder notification may be.

member.summary: Creates an object of the specified type identifier.
member.param: Identifies the Type of object to be created (0 = ResourcePreference).
member.returns: A new instance of the WebObjectBase-derived type.
member.exception: Thrown when the numeric typeId passed is unrecognized and/or not supported. Pass a supported typeId (0).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ResourcePreferencesCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets/sets a ResourcePreference object at the specified index.
member.param: A zero-based index less than the Count of preference objects within the collection.
member.returns: The ResourcePreference object at the specified index.

remarks.p: The index value should correspond to the sequence number of the [ResourcePreference] row in a many-to-one relationship with the parent [Resource] row. WebSchedule currently supports only a single instance of a ResourcePreference being associated with any given Resource object, but this relationship has been reserved to allow for multiple preference objects in the future.

member.exception: Thrown when the index specified exceeds the number of ResourcePreference objects already in the collection. Use an index within the bounds of the collection, or do not index from an empty collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.ScheduleMatrix
member.summary: This class controls the means by which appointments are dispersed into AppointmentSubsetCollections suitable for rendering. The class utilizes a an ArrayList of Resources called resourceMatrices. Each ResourceMatrice consists of an Array that contains one entry for each calendar day within the current FrameInterval. Each ResourceMatrice entry is then populated with whatever Appointment objects are relevant to the date represented by the slot. The FrameInterval represents the span of calendar dates that are currently relevant to what WebSchedule is displaying within the user interface. The FrameInterval is normally controlled by the UI elements hooked up to WebScheduleInfo, although the FrameInterval may also be extended by the application.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo
member.summary: Manages and exposes all schedule-related information for one or more WebSchedule view elements.

remarks.p: The WebScheduleInfo control centralizes all of the date specific and behavioral information common to several WebSchedule view elements. A WebScheduleInfo control itself is non-visual. Instead, it orchestrates several WebSchedule view elements. Applications can access the WebScheduleInfo control from a view by using their WebScheduleInfo property. Every view then shares the same Activity and Resource information without redundancy.

The minimum and maximum dates all WebSchedule view elements will display Activity information for is called the frame interval. This date range will automatically be calculated based on the needs of all attached views, but an application may extend the frame interval by handling the server-side event.

The property tracks the active date, affecting each view element attached to this instance of the WebScheduleInfo (views may render the active date differently than other dates). By setting the property an application can enforce synchronization of the active day on the client-side.

Schedule information can be displayed for a single active resource. Resources are the people, places, or things which can have scheduled activities. If an application does not use Resources explicitly, then WebScheduleInfo assumes the existence of the "Unassigned" resource. Applications can tailor their WebSchedule presentation to show schedules for different resources by setting the property in the Page_Load event handler.
The and properties are used to calculate the week numbers for a particular year, and determine on which day a week should begin.

WebScheduleInfo can be connected to a WebSchedule data provider that implements the IDataFetch (set on the property) and IDataUpdate (set on the property) interfaces. A data provider manages reading and writing of Activity and Resource information to external data sources.

member.summary: Replacement tag used to include the activity's Free | Tentative | Busy status. It is used by the AppointmentFormatString and AppointmentTooltipFormatString properties.

remarks.p: Use this replacement tag to indicate an activity's ShowTimeAs status on your WebSchedule view element. This is particularly important to comply with Accessibility guidelines for an audience who cannot perceive information conveyed by color only, as is done with WebDayView's activity edge styles.
The text description for the values of the enumeration are taken from your resource assembly's localized string literals.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.FormatTag_ALL_DAY_EVENT
member.summary: Replacement tag used to insert an All Day event indication into the brief description of an activity. It is used by the AppointmentFormatString and AppointmentTooltipFormatString properties.

remarks.p: Normally, all day events and activities are rendered with a different style or in different positions within a WebSchedule view element. These distinctions may not always be discernable by end users visiting your site with a disability. To enable more users to distinguish an all day event compared to an activity, your application should use this replacement tag in the AppointmentFormatString to indicate an event as being all day.
The text description replacing this tag is taken from your resource assembly's localized string literals.

member.summary: Binds to activity and resource information through an associated WebSchedule data provider control.

remarks.p: A WebSchedule data provider is normally attached by setting the WebScheduleInfoID property of the data provider to the unique ID string of the WebScheduleInfo at design-time (see the property for further details.)
Unless called manually by an application, the WebScheduleInfo will data bind automatically after the PreRender event takes place. This is called just in time data binding.

Data binding must clear all prior Activity and Resource information from this WebScheduleInfo control. When an application adds their own dynamic activities to the collection, the DataBind method should be called first to prevent these activities from being cleared.
If an was not set before data binding takes place, then the WebScheduleInfo will assume the "Unassigned" resource should be used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.GetWeekNumberForDate(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.SmartDate)
member.summary: Returns the week number for a particular date using the current and .
member.param: SmartDate
member.returns: Integer denoting the week number that the date belongs to.

remarks.p: The System.Globalization.Calendar's GetWeekOfYear method simply returns the number of weeks into the year that the date falls on. It does not seem to use the weekrule specified in the arguments. e.g. If the first day of week is sunday and the weekrule is Jan 1, then 12/31/2000 (Sunday) should return 1. Instead it returns 54 and 1/1/2001 (Monday) returns 1.
This routine returns the correct week number for the specified date based on the and .

Note, this may be a week for a year other than the year of the date. e.g. 12/31/2000, week rule of Jan 1, and week start of sunday will return 1 because this date falls into the first week of the year 2001.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.GetWeekNumberForDate(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.SmartDate,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the week number for a particular date using the current and .
member.param: SmartDate
Out integer to receive the year for which the week number belongs.
member.returns: Integer denoting the week number that the date belongs to.

remarks.p: The System.Globalization.Calendar's GetWeekOfYear method simply returns the number of weeks into the year that the date falls on. It does not seem to use the weekrule specified in the arguments. e.g. If the first day of week is sunday and the weekrule is Jan 1, then 12/31/2000 (Sunday) should return 1. Instead it returns 54 and 1/1/2001 (Monday) returns 1.
This routine returns the correct week number for the specified date based on the and .

Note, this may be a week for a year other than the year of the date. e.g. 12/31/2000, week rule of Jan 1, and week start of sunday will return 1 because this date falls into the first week of the year 2001.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.GetResourceCss(System.String)
member.summary:
Get embedded css. If control supports embedded StyleSheets, then it should override this method.
If cssStyleSheetName represents embedded css, then control should return value of the first param in the WebResourceAttribute with which that CSS-file was linked to. If control supports multiple embedded css, then besides empty-string it also should process other values of cssStyleSheetName param. For multiple CSSes the logic may assume syntax: "[nameOfFileOrPreset]", where "[" flag for embedded resource and "nameOfFileOrPreset" is short name of embedded file of a flag for particular preset. It also should validate for explicit path like "Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CSS.Default.ig_webdayview.css"
member.param: The value of this.StyleSheetFileName property.
member.returns: Control must return null if cssStyleSheetName is not an embedded resource.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.DataFetch
member.summary: Specifies an implementation of the IDataFetch interface WebScheduleInfo uses during it's DataBind method.

remarks.p: WebScheduleInfo requires an implementation to load Activity objects into the collection when data bound.

The WebSchedule data provider normally sets this property automatically when applications set their WebScheduleInfo property at run-time (or WebScheduleInfoID at design-time). When using a custom data provider, applications may need to set this property directly (please consult the documentation accompanying your custom data provider).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.DataUpdate
member.summary: Specifies an implementation of the IDataUpdate interface WebScheduleInfo uses to add and update information received from the client.

remarks.p: WebScheduleInfo requires an implementation to add, update and delete Activity objects from external data sources. Failure to set this property before the LoadPostData method is called by ASP.NET to process information returned from the client causes update operations to appear nonfunctional.

The WebSchedule data provider normally sets this property automatically when applications set their WebScheduleInfo property at run-time (or WebScheduleInfoID at design-time). When using a custom data provider, applications may need to set this property directly (please consult the documentation accompanying your custom data provider).

remarks.p: The WebScheduleInfo component centralizes all the date specific state information into a single component that can be referenced from all the UltraSchedule controls (). This allows the controls to share the same information across all the controls without the need to maintain the same information on each control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.WeekRule
member.summary: The rule used to determine how the first week of the year is calculated.

remarks.p: The .NET Framework supports several calendar rules for calculating the first week of each year with it's CalendarWeekRule enumeration. WebScheduleInfo allows applications to use any of the supported calendar rules for all attached WebSchedule view elements.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.FirstDayOfWeekResolved
member.summary: Returns the day of the week considered the start of the week.

remarks.p: By default, the property is set to Default. When left set to this, the considered the first day of the week is based on the system settings of the system using the component.

The and FirstDayOfWeekResolved are used to calculate the date which starts the first week of the year. As such, a object is not fixed to a particular range of dates but is instead associated with a range of dates based on the calculated first week of the year. For more information on how the date of the first week of the year is calculated, refer to the method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Returns or sets the used as the first day of the week for various date calculations.

remarks.p: The default value for this property is Default which means that the FirstDayOfWeek used is based on the current system settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.AllowAllDayEvents
member.summary: Gets/sets whether AllDayEvents will be allowed.

remarks.p: When AllowAllDayEvents is set to false, any WebDayView attached to this ScheduleInfo will not display an AllDayEventArea. Also, the Appointment Dialog will not show an "All Day Event" CheckBox. The AllDayEvent proeprty of any appointments in the collection will be ignored and all Appointments will be displayed as though AllDayEvent were false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.ActiveDayUtc
member.summary: Returns a object representing the current active day. The active day is always in UTC.

remarks.p: The active day determines which area in the UI is current and highlighted. As the user navigates from one date to another in the UI, this ActiveDayUtc property is updated to reflect the new date that has become active.
Users can change the active day by clicking on a different day or by clicking on a navigation button to move to the next day, week or month.
An active date always has a UTC (Universal Coordinated Time) component, because the day seen as active by users from different timezones may differ.

UTC times do not take into account any "daylight savings" adjustment. If users are currently using "daylight savings" time, then the application must compensate for the one hour difference when setting the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.ActiveResourceName
member.summary: Gets/sets the resource name for the currently displayed, or active resource for all attached WebSchedule view elements.

remarks.p: A resource is the person, place, or thing, for which activities can be scheduled. The active resource is the resource whose activities are currently being displayed by all attached WebSchedule view elements.

Applications should set the ActiveResourceName property to the name of the Resource object affiliated with the schedule information end users would like to see. This name must match a value in the [ResourceName] column of the [Resource] table in the WebSchedule data model. The data model requires [ResourceName] values to be unique.
If used, this property must be set before calling the method to be effective.
Active resource names can typically be set using an end user's logon name, or some looked-up user ID value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.ActiveResource
member.summary: Returns a reference to the active Resource object for attached WebSchedule views.

remarks.p: An ActiveResource object reference is initialized automatically during the "FetchResource" operation in data binding, when the [Resource] table is accessed using the value an application has assigned to the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.LoggedOnUserName
member.summary: Identifies the currently logged on user for WebSchedule.
member.value: Returns a String value representing the currently logged on user for WebSchedule view elements associated with this WebScheduleInfo.

remarks.p: WebScheduleInfo uses this property solely for the purpose of comparing it to the . When the two properties are equivalent, reminder notifications are displayed to the end user when an Activity becomes current (it's starting time less the ReminderInterval meets or exceeds the current system time) and expire (it's starting time meets or exceeds the current system time, meaning the Activity has started and is now in the past).

Reminder notifications are suppressed if the LoggedOnUserName is not the same as the ActiveResourceName because this tells WebSchedule that the end user reviewing the active resource's activities is not their owner. Multiple users may review a schedule for one specified resource, but perhaps only one of them wishes to receive reminder notifications because the activity directly impacts him or her. The application is responsible for authenticating an end user's identity to ensure reminders are only displayed to the correct or interested users.
Reminder notifications may also be overridden if an application handles the DataBinding event and turns off the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.EnableReminders
member.summary: Determines whether reminder notifications for the are enabled by default.
member.value: Whether reminder notifications are enabled on this WebScheduleInfo (and any views attached to it); the default value is True (reminders are enabled.)

remarks.p: Determines whether the reminder dialog should pop-up for the end user when their name matches the and an activity (with a reminder enabled on it) is about to start (or has already started.) To shut off all reminders developers only need to set EnableReminders to False.
Reminders can also be turned off for an individual Resource by locating the Resource in the collection and setting it's EnableReminders property to False.

Reminders can also be disabled on individual Activity instances. Developers can set the EnableReminder property to False. When an activity has a reminder pending it renders the icon of a ringing bell (although this image is customizable.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.VisibleResources
member.summary: Returns the collection of Resource objects. Resources are used to identify the entity to which an Activity belongs. In the WebSchedule data model, there are multiple Resources, each of which can have many activities associated. The particular resource that is displayed within UI controls depends on the ActiveResource property setting. By setting the ActiveResourceName string property to a known resource in the system, the Resource object will be automatically populated from the data source.

remarks.p: Neutral Cultures are not supported. See .

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments applying to the FrameIntervalChanging event.

remarks.p: The FrameIntervalChanging event is fired during the data binding process to mediate the date ranges required by all interested participants. Through this negotiation, the WebScheduleInfo control determines a frame interval size appropriate for the WebSchedule view elements displaying activities.

Applications can extend the FrameInterval, but cannot make it any shorter because other WebSchedule view elements would then fail to fill completely with the activities they need. Requests to shorten the frame interval are ignored. Excessively long frame intervals can negatively impact performance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs.#ctor(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameInterval)
member.summary: Constructs a FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs object.
member.param: Contains the starting date and ending date of the frame interval.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs.FrameInterval
member.summary: Contains the starting and ending dates of the frame interval.

remarks.p: These dates are made available in both Universal Time (UTC) and local time. Local time is determined by the TimeZoneOffset property on the WebScheduleInfo control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs.Updated
member.summary: Indicates whether an event listener has updated the FrameInterval property.
member.value: True if any event listener has updated the frame interval; otherwise false.

remarks.p: Set the Updated property to True if your event handler updates the FrameInterval property. If another event handler has set this property, then you cannot unset it's value.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Object that keeps the list of names for event function handlers used by JavaScript on client side.
member.remarks:
Because of the stateless nature of web connections, and the typical delays involved in returning information from the server, WebMenu implements both client-side events and server-side events. You can choose whether you would like to respond to client-side events, which must be implemented through JavaScript. The ClientSideEvent object maintains a list of event handlers that are implemented on the client and called in response to events as they occur in the browser. Each event is a string that represents JavaScript function name. The named function must be implemented by the developer in JavaScript code.
Every event function handler should have 3 parameters (the InitializeTabs has only 1 parameter). The first parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents UltraWebTab.
The second parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Tab.
The third parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Event.
Look at the events description for details.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ContentPane
member.summary: The ContentPane object handles context displayed in the UltraWebTab when a particular object is selected.

ul.li: It can display the which is rendered as the <IFRAME> html element, or it may have explicit child controls that are placed within the <DIV> html element and are rendered using the standard logic of the .NET.

Child controls can be constructed and added to the or to the Controls from code at run time, or they can be built at design time using the templates: right-mouse-click on the UltraWebTab and select "Edit Template" option.
If the TargetUrl is not set, then the child controls are rendered automatically.
The background color of the ContentPane is defined by the BackColor of the .

The ContentPane may have optional border. If none of properties related to border is set and ContentPane has TargetUrl, then' the default border of the <IFRAME> html element is used. Border properties are applied for both modes: TargetUrl and child controls.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ContentPane.Scrollable
member.summary: Behavior of scroll bars that are used for the container of child controls.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If scrollbars are enabled, then they work better when is enabled.
If is disabled, then the size of UltraWebTab may depend on the size of ContentPane and there can be nothing to scroll.
That property is used to set the value of the OVERFLOW attribute of the DIV html element that represents the ContentPane.
The value of Visible is the browser-default for the OVERFLOW and ContentPane should be fully visible (depends on a particular browser).

member.summary: Returns or sets the title of the iframe used by TargetUrl.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ContentPane.EnableRelativeLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the request render relative position for ContentPane.

remarks.p: Notes: That property is designed to get around differences in behavior of different browsers, when child elements of ContentPane have relative or absolute positions. It is recommended to enable that property when child controls or parts of html generated by them use position:relative or position:absolute. For example, UltraWebGrid uses position:relative style attribute, and therefore, it may fail to be scrolled in IE or it may go out of tab bounds in other browsers.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ContentPane.IsAsyncPostBack
member.summary: Internal use only.

summary.p: Returns the collection of child controls that will be displayed within the .

remarks.p: The Children collection contains all of the child controls that will be displayed when a particular tab is selected. There are currently two ways in which child controls can be added to the Children collection, at Design-Time using Template Editor and at Run-Time from code.
To add controls at run-time: Add the UltraWebTab control to an aspx page. Add code similar to the following to create and add your control to the ContentPane of a Tab object.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.TabOrientation
member.summary: Used with the TabOrientation property of the UltraWebTab object.

remarks.p: The TabOrientation enumerations are comprised of the tab orientation and the alignment of the tabs, respectively. Eg. The enum TopLeft will render the tab objects to render along the top of the content area and aligned to the left side of the control.

summary.p: Tabs are rendered across the top of the control, aligned to the left side.
Tabs are rendered across the top of the control, aligned to the right side.
Tabs are rendered across the bottom of the control, aligned to the left side.
Tabs are rendered across the bottom of the control, aligned to the right side.
Tabs are rendered down the left side of the control, aligned to the top.
Tabs are rendered down the left side of the control, aligned to the bottom.
Tabs are rendered down the right side of the control, aligned to the top.
Tabs are rendered down the right side of the control, aligned to the bottom.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.TextOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of text rendered in the tab objects.

remarks.p: Permitted values are Horizontal and Vertical.

In all Netscape browsers and browsers prior to version 6.0 Vertical text indicates that the text will be rendered such that each letter is on a new line from top to bottom. On IE6 the text will be rotated 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.TextOrientation.Vertical

summary.p: Specifies the style to render RoundedImage.
Image can not be stretched and it is used as it is. While rendering, a tab is subdivided on 2-3 parts and every part is painted separately using different parts of provided image.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.None
member.summary:
Rounded images are not used.
Tabs are painted using the BackColor and border related subproperties of the Tab's Style properties.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.LeftRightOnly
member.summary:
The border is not painted and the background of the center part of tab is filled by the BackColor of Style properties.
Tab is devided on 3 parts. To render the left side of tab,- the left part of image is used. To render the right side of tab,- the right part of image is used. Image is not used to fill center part of tab, and an application should provide the background color(s) within the DefaultTabStyle (and HoverTabStyle, SelectedTabStyle and DisabledTabStyle in case of different images) property of UltraWebTab.
Notes:
The values of BackColor in Style properties of tabs should match with the background color of images that are used to draw rounded edges.
This style allows to uses image(s) with the smallest possible size(s), because the only edges of image are used, however, the center parts of tabs are painted flat.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.LeftMergedWithCenter
member.summary:
The border and background are not painted.
Tab is devided on 2 parts. To render the left side of tab and its center,- the left part of image is used. To render the right side of tab,- the right part of image is used. The background color is not used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImageStyle.RightMergedWithCenter
member.summary:
The border and background are not painted.
Tab is devided on 2 parts. To render the right side of tab and its center,- the right part of image is used. To render the left side of tab,- the left part of image is used. The background color is not used.

member.summary: The options related to request while hidden asynchronous post back.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.AsyncRequestContext.IncludeFormData
member.summary: Pass to the server data of all controls on the page.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.AsyncRequestContext.IncludePreviousSelectedTab
member.summary: Pass to the server only data of the child controls located on the previously unselected tab.

remarks.p: Notes: That option may slow down performance on client, but speed up performance on server. If a child control located on the ContentPane of unselected tab renders its data field outside of the DIV element of ContentPane, then data of that control will be lost.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.AsyncRequestContext.IncludeAllTabs
member.summary: Pass to the server only data of child controls located on tabs.

remarks.p: Notes: That option may slow down performance on client, but speed up performance on server. If a child control located on the ContentPane of a tab renders its data field outside of the DIV element of ContentPane, then data of that control will be lost.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage
member.summary: Container of properties that define rounded shape for UltraWebTab tabs.

ul.li: To enable rounded images the property should be used.
When rounded images are enabled, then outter border around tabs is not painted and background is not filled by the BackColor. However, the BackColor is used to fill background of ContentPane.
If the property is not set, then default images are used.
The width/height of images should be larger than the width/height of the largest tab.

The UltraWebTab may use a single (custom) image for all styles. To customize rounded images for other states of tab such as mouse-over, selected and disabled, corresponding image-properties should be set as well.

Not all configurations of TabOrientation and TextOrientation are supported for a particular browser,- due to limitation of browsers to properly align background image. In this case,- normal borders and background colors will be used automatically instead of rounded images.

To support down level browsers such as Netscape 4/5:
In addition to the Normal/Selected image properties, the and/or should be set as well.
In case of the bottom (or right) tab orientation,- the height (width) of images should match with the height (width) of tabs.

member.summary: The default public constructor.

member.summary:
The name of the file that contains the background image used for a tab in the normal state.
If that property is not set, then the default image is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.HoverImage
member.summary:
The name of the file that contains the background image used for a tab in the "mouse-over" state.
If that property is not set, then the NormalImage is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.SelectedImage
member.summary:
The name of the file that contains the background image used for a tab in the selected state.
If that property is not set, then the NormalImage is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.DisabledImage
member.summary:
The name of the file that contains the background image used for a tab in the disabled state.
If that property is not set, then the NormalImage is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.DownLevelNormalRightImage
member.summary:
The name of the file that contains the right edge of a rounded image which is used for a tab in the normal state.
That property is used only for a down level browser such as Netscape 4/5.
If that property is not set, then the default file-image is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.DownLevelSelectedRightImage
member.summary:
The name of the file that contains the right edge of a rounded image which is used for a tab in the selected state.
This property is used only for a down level browser such as Netscape 4/5.
If that property is not set, then the default file-image is used.
If that property is not set, then the DownLevelNormalRightImage is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.LeftSideWidth
member.summary: The width in pixels of the part of the rounded image displayed on the left side of the tab. The default value is set to 5 pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.RightSideWidth
member.summary: The width in pixels of the part of the rounded image displayed on the right side of the tab. The default value is set to 5 pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.ShiftOfImages
member.summary:
The shift in pixels of all rounded images besides the image for the selected state. The default value is set to 0 pixels.
This property has effect only if all of the following conditions are true:
Browser is up-level
UltraWebTab has top or left tab orientation
The value of the FillStyle property is LeftMergedWithCenter or RightMergedWithCenter
In case of the top-tab orientations,- the images are shifted down, in case of the left-tab orientations,- the images are shifted to the right.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.RoundedImage.FillStyle
member.summary:
Sets gets value that determines how the rounded image(s) should be rendered.
Image can not be stretched and it is used as it is.

member.summary: The names of the file that contains the background image used for a tab when the NormalImage is not set.

member.summary: Images that are displayed on the more-tabs buttons and their locations.
member.p: To draw "more-tabs" buttons, the and cursor of type "hand" are used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.UseBrowserDefaults
member.summary: Automatically adjust the appearance of buttons to match with the appearance of button elements used by a particular browser on the client.

remarks.p: Default value is true.

Note: If any appearance related property is set, then those values are not affected and they have priority over corresponding "automatic" defaults.
At the time the ScrollButtons support only 3 types of predifined styles:
Internet Explorer under WindowsXP blue.
Internet Explorer under Windows2000.
Netscape Navigator.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.Delay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds between scroll events while the button is pressed.

remarks.p: Default value is set to 300.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.Visibility
member.summary: The location of scroll buttons.

remarks.p: If that property is set to the value other than None, then scroll buttons appear regardless of the number of tabs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of scroll buttons.

remarks.p: That property gives visual effect, when the Height of the property is set.

If the Height is not set, then 100% is used. However, Netscape Navigator may fail to render the button the whole height of the tabs and, therefore, it is recommended to set a particular value to the Height.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.ShowPartialTabs
member.summary: Show or hide partially visible tabs that appear on the right side of UltraWebTab.

remarks.p: Note: If a particular browser does not allow to process resizing events, then the value of false for that property may lead to misbehavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.AllowScrollToLastTab
member.summary: Allow scrolling to the very last tab on the right.

remarks.p: Default value is false.
Note: If a particular browser does not allow to process resizing events, then the value of false for that property may lead to misbehavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButtons.OuterBorderColor
member.summary: Color of the outer border around a scroll button.

remarks.p: Border is solid and 1 pixel wide. If color is empty, then no outer border is rendered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.Image
member.summary: The name of the url that contains the image used for a button in the normal state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If the string is empty and is true, then the default images are used.
If the length of the string is less than 5, or it does not contain the "." character surrounded by letters or digits, then that property is rendered as an explicit text string, rather than as an image.
If this property is not set, then the < character is used as text that appears on the left button, and the > character is used for the right button.
In order to disable that automatic text,- the " " (empty space character) or the " " should be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.HoverImage
member.summary: The name of the url that contains the image used for a button in the "mouse-over" state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If the Image property is not set to an image, then this property has no effect.
If that property is not set, then the Image property is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.PressedImage
member.summary: The name of the url that contains the image used for a button in the selected state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If the Image property is not set to an image, then this property has no effect.
If that property is not set, then the Image property is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.ScrollButton.DisabledImage
member.summary: The name of the url that contains the image used for a button in the disabled state.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If the Image property is not set to an image, then this property has no effect.
If that property is not set, then the Image property is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.MoreTabs.Visibility
member.summary: The locations where the more-tabs buttons can appear.

remarks.p: If this property is set to a value other than None, then the "more-tabs" buttons at run time appear dynamically and only they are needed.
The "more-tabs" buttons process mouse-down events and scroll tabs.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.Tab
member.summary: The Tab object represents a selectable item in the Tab control that will change the contents displayed depending on the settings of the ContentPane object.

ul.li: The Tab may be painted by 4 different styles depending on the instant state of a tab: normal, mouse-over, selected, disabled.
Every state of tab may have different image.

The of a tab may have the which is rendered as the <IFRAME> html element. Or it may have explicit child controls that are placed within the <DIV> html element and are rendered using the standard logic of the .NET.
If the TargetUrl is not set, then the child controls are rendered automatically.
Some of the Tab properties can be modified on the client using the JavaScript functionality and persist values between sessions.
The subproperties of the are merged with the and the UltraWebTab.ControlStyle.
The subproperties of the are merged with the , , , and UltraWebTab.ControlStyle
The subproperties of the are merged with the , , , and UltraWebTab.ControlStyle

The subproperties of the are merged with the , , , and UltraWebTab.ControlStyle.
If ForeColor is not set, then the Gray color is used automatically.

The background of the is painted by the SelectedStyle.BackColor color.
In order to paint the background of a tab by different color than the background of the ContentPane,- the CustomRules can be used.

member.summary: String of text that is displayed by the object.

remarks.p:
If string contains the ' ' characters and the RoundedImages () are enabled, then to prevent possible increased height due to soft-line breaks, those characters should be replaced by the " ". In order to ensure multi-lined text, the "
" tag can be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.TabItem.ImageAlign
member.summary: Alignment of image relative to text.

remarks.p: Not all browsers may support that property.
Any value valid for "" property can be used. For example, absbottom absmiddle baseline bottom left middle right texttop top Default value is left

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.TabItem.Visible
member.summary: Show or hide this tab item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.TabItem.NextRow
member.summary: Flag to move this TabItem and all following items in the collection to the next row.

remarks.p:
Notes:
This property has effect only if is set to the MultiRow and the orientation of tabs is horizontal.
If the BackColor property of UltraWebTab is set, then its value is used as the background color behind all tabs except tabs in the last (outer) row.
If this property is set to true for this TabItem and this is an instance of TabSeparator, then the next TabItem will be located on the same row regardless of the value of its NextRow property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.Tab.FindControl(System.String)
member.summary: Get a reference to a child aspx-control located within the ContentPane of this tab by its id.

remarks.p: This method will recursively search the child controls of each child control, until either a match is found, or all controls have been searched.

This method can not be used to get a reference to a child control located within TargetUrl. In case of controls located within the Page of TargetUrl,- a reference to the document and html elements can be obtain using JavaScript functionality on the client.

member.param: The id of child control.
member.returns: Reference to Control or null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.Tab.AccessKey
member.summary: The keyboard shortcut to select this tab.

remarks.p: The access-key is the feature of a browser, which is triggered by the keyboard entry of Alt+key.
That property is supported only for InternetExplorer, which allows to set focus to the <TD> html element.
If the <u> string is not found in the Text of this tab and the value of AccessKey is set as the UPPER-case-letter, then the first found access-character in the Text is rendered with underscore.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.Tab.AsyncOption
member.summary: Custom behavior when AsyncMode of UltraWebTab is enabled.

remarks.p: Note: In case of LoadOnDemand the states of fields (like TextBox) located on unselected tabs can not persist between postbacks, therefore, if application needs up-to-date values of those fields, then that option can not be used.

Warning: LoadOnDemand may trigger full post backs and lead to errors, exceptions and other side effects. Therefore, application should test all possible scenarious. If error happens, then this property should be disabled.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.Tabs.GetTabIndex(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.Tab)
member.summary: Get the index of a Tab from its reference within items of the Tab class.
member.param: Reference to the Tab or null.Index of Tab.
member.returns: Index of Tab or -1. Separators are skipped. For example, if there is a separator between 1st and 2nd tabs, then GetTab(secondTab) will return 1.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.UltraWebTab.Tabs.ConvertTabIndexToCollectionIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert the index of an item within instances of the Tab class to the index of that item within the whole collection.

remarks.p:
Below is an example of usage.
Assume that an application has 6 TabItems which include: TabSeparator, Tab ("Tab1"), Tab ("Tab2"), TabSeparator, TabSeparator, Tab ("Tab3").
Within instances of the Tab objects (skipping separators), the index of the Tab with Text equal to "Tab2" is 1, but the index of that Tab within all TabItems is 2.
So, UltraWebTab1.Tabs.ConvertTabIndexToCollectionIndex(1) will return the value of 2. Similar, for the Tab with Text equal to "Text3", the UltraWebTab1.Tabs.ConvertTabIndexToCollectionIndex(2) will return the value of 5.

member.param: Index of an item within items of the Tab class (skipping separators).
member.returns: Index of a Tab item within all items in the collection or the value -1.
